plots: Returning home , the rest of the gang almost blows the secret , and Chandler decides to act like marriage is the furthest thing from his mind , so Monica wo n't get suspicious .

Rachel pretends that the friends are excited about this charity event rather than the upcoming proposal .

plots: Ross quickly claims he and Elizabeth are great together , and his friends are all wrong ... until Ross sees Elizabeth having a water balloon fight with her buddies .
Ross visits Elizabeth in her dorm room during a water balloon fight .
A dorm - room water - balloon fight shows Ross that Ross 's relationship with Elizabeth does n't have a future , so Ross breaks up with Elizabeth .
Ross 's girlfriend , Elizabeth , starts a water balloon fight in her dorm .

plots: While Phoebe is obviously over-drinking , Joey has bigger problems ; misunderstanding the silent auction process , Joey thought that bidders guessed an item 's worth , with the prize going to the person with the closest guess .
Phoebe drinks a lot ; Joey thinks the silent auction is just a contest to guess the right price , and Joey ends up buying a sailboat for $ 20,000 .

utterances.transcript_with_note: {Transcriber's Note For further reading on the above story, please check out <a href="http://thecfsi.com/season2/216jmo.htm">The One Where Joey Moves Out.}

utterances.transcript_with_note: (An awkward silence ensues.)

utterances.transcript: It's so great seeing you guys again. I'd like to make a toast. Uh, as a poet once said, "In the sweetness of friendship, let there be laughter and sharing of pleasures for in the due of little things the heart finds it's morning and is refreshed."
utterances.transcript_with_note: It's so great seeing you guys again. I'd like to make a toast. (Everyone raises their glasses) Uh, as a poet once said, "In the sweetness of friendship, let there be laughter and sharing of pleasures for in the due of little things the heart finds it's morning and is refreshed."

utterances.transcript: Ohh.

plots: Richard concludes a series of awkward parental anecdotes with a lovely toast about friendship .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica and Chandler are returning to find Ross is there waiting for them.]

utterances.transcript: Oh my God, you guys!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh my God, you guys!! (He's excited about what he thought happened.)

utterances.transcript: Before you say anything, have we got a story for you! Guess who we bumped into at dinner!

utterances.transcript: Who?

utterances.transcript: What? A-ohh! Ohh. Oh that's right that's right. That's Richard's favorite place too.

utterances.transcript: Oh you knew that. Good!
I thought you were going out with Elizabeth.

utterances.transcript: Oh Ross, sometimes grown-ups have commitments they just can't get out of!

utterances.transcript: Y'know, maybe she is too young for me. Y'know, when I was over there and she was running around with her friends, I felt like I was a baby-sitter. I finally started to see what you guys were talking about. I don't know what to do.

utterances.transcript: Why don't you just weigh out the good stuff about the relationship against the bad stuff. I mean that's what I did when I first weighing stuff.

utterances.transcript: Okay umm, bad stuff. Well, I'm-I'm 12 years older than she is.

utterances.transcript: If the school finds out you're fired.

utterances.transcript: Hmm.
She's leaving for three months.

utterances.transcript: For camp!

utterances.transcript: Okay, good stuff. Umm, well she's-she's sweet and pretty and...
